image.altText: Circular salmon pens seen from the air.

props.synopsis: A mass mortality event that hit Tasmania's salmon industry has ended, the state's environmental watchdog says, as industry reporting shows fish deaths in March halved from the previous month.

title.children: Tasmania's salmon mass mortality event is over, EPA says

image.altText: a close up of hands holding dried green cannabis flower in hands over a bag of dried cannabis

props.synopsis: Australian farmers say they have the capacity to supply the nation's medicinal cannabis needs, but the federal government is over-reliant on imports from countries with fewer restrictions — raising threats to jobs and quality assurance.

title.children: 'Bleak future' ahead: Australian cannabis farmers unite against 'import-flooded' market

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair in a composite with a woman with brunette hair.

props.synopsis: With four of Tasmania's six Senate spots certain, four candidates including Jacqui Lambie and Pauline Hanson's daughter are vying for the last two.

title.children: Jacqui Lambie battling Pauline Hanson's daughter Lee for Senate spot

image.altText: An aerial view of Ashley Youth Detention Centre.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government says the closure of the troubled Ashley Youth Detention centre will be delayed until early 2028, instead of the planned time frame of next year.

title.children: Closure of notorious Tasmanian 'jail for kids' postponed again

image.altText: Two men in white polo shirts posing for a photo sitting on stairs.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's AFL club has secured star recruiting pair Derek Hine and Todd Patterson as it continues preparations to enter the national league.

title.children: Tasmania Devils land gun pair in recruiting coup for fledgling AFL club

image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government plans to fund construction of the stadium via borrowings, rather than looking to partner with the private sector, saying the latter would carry too high a risk to the state and threaten already tight timelines.

title.children: Tasmanian government to go it alone on AFL stadium funding

image.altText: A man wearing an American Badass t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Most Greenlanders oppose the US president's threats to invade, but some believe it could give them leverage in their fight for independence from Denmark.

title.children: Greenland's problem? 'Not enough MAGA hats' to go around

image.altText: Coonabarabran

props.synopsis: The Coonabarabran community in north-west NSW is in shock today after two young boys were found dead inside a home. A 66-year-old woman was arrested at the scene.

title.children: Grandmother in custody as town reels after deaths of two young boys

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns as he looks off camera while Xi Jinping stands behind him.

props.synopsis: America has decided to sever its trading relationship with China — a strategy that ultimately will come at enormous cost. And Australia, more than any other nation, will be caught smack in the middle.

title.children: The world is becoming a dangerous place. Australia is caught in the middle

image.altText: Close up of Zendaya in white suit wearing white hat

props.synopsis: Follow along in our live blog as some of the biggest stars grace the Met Gala steps for fashion's night of nights.

title.children: Zendaya, Sarah Snook and Diana Ross shine as stars arrive at Met Gala

image.altText: Photo collage Peter Dutton, Michael Sukkar, David Coleman and Bridget Archer

props.synopsis: And it's dealt a serious blow to their pipeline of future leadership talent.

title.children: The Liberals' suburban wipe-out has complicated leadership discussions

image.altText: ANTHONY ALBANESE SELFIE

props.synopsis: Over the past year when I'd talk to him privately, the prime minister was saying that Peter Dutton's vote would be dragged down by Donald Trump, whether or not he became president.

title.children: Anthony Albanese was confident Peter Dutton would be left exposed

image.altText: a male politician wearing glasses looking dismayed

props.synopsis: Liberal internal polling was predicting as late as the final week that it would pick up seats, leaving it sleepwalking into disaster.

title.children: Most polls underestimated Labor. How did they get it wrong?

image.altText: A chart tracks stock market lower

props.synopsis: ASX futures point to falls after US stocks fell overnight. Meanwhile, Donald Trump has announced film tariffs and traders are awaiting the Federal Reserve meeting. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street ends nine-session winning streak ahead of US rates decision

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: An update on Australia's Future Fund
Seven to buy remaining Southern Cross TV assets

image.altText: An elderly woman holding the hand of her adult son on a sidewalk

props.synopsis: Estate planning before your own death can be confronting for anyone. But for parents who have children with disabilities, there are additional complexities to consider.

title.children: Dan used to care for his 95yo mum. Now it's the other way around

image.altText: An old lady sits, leaning on a wall as she holds an empty metal pot.

props.synopsis: As people queue for hours for a bowl of soup, Israel maintains its blockade of food and aid — and the groups keeping people fed warn their supplies are running out.

title.children: Outside Gaza sits 116,000 tonnes of food as people inside run out

image.altText: Bejnamin Netanyahu wearing a navy jacket, white shirt and a gold and Israeli flag lapel pin while grimacing

props.synopsis: Israel has approved plans to seize the Gaza Strip and stay in the Palestinian territory for an unspecified amount of time, Israeli officials say.

title.children: Palestinians would be moved to Gaza's south under 'intensive' Israeli plan

image.altText: Electric vehicle plugged into a charger on a tree-lined city street.

props.synopsis: As new electric vehicle sales rise, more EVs are entering the used-car market. Are used-EV batteries any good, and how can you check?

title.children: How long can you expect a battery to last in a second-hand EV?

image.altText: An anonymous cardinal wearing bright red robes with gold accents looks up.

props.synopsis: In its 800-year history, a conclave has never been this diverse. How will this changing face of Catholicism impact the result of the papal vote?

title.children: 'He's one of us': Catholics around the world are watching the conclave

image.altText: Jenny Hutson March 20 2025

props.synopsis: Regulators spent $2.8 million probing controversial deals involving Australian childcare giant G8 Education — an investigation that resulted in only one successful criminal action and a $5,000 penalty for a lawyer.

title.children: $2.8m probe into childcare giant resulted in $5,000 penalty for lawyer

image.altText: A man in a white shirt holds his belly and laughs. Several people holding Liberal placards stand behind him looking happy

props.synopsis: While regional voters have bucked the Labor trend in Western Australia, they are also drifting away from both major parties.

title.children: Liberal Party rides on the sheep's back in country WA

image.altText: A woman in a light-coloured blazer.

props.synopsis: Newly-elected SA MP Claire Clutterham says her varied career — including an international role as a lawyer — has prepared her for her new role as the first woman to represent the seat of Sturt in Adelaide's eastern suburbs.

title.children: Newly elected MP who defied her own party's polling

image.altText: China Boat Accident 3

props.synopsis: More than 80 people have plunged into a river following strong winds that capsized four tourist boats in China.

title.children: Ten people killed after tourist boats capsize in China

image.altText: Two female travellers look frustrated as they sit on a footpath surrounded by luggage and people

props.synopsis: Copper thieves bring part of Spain's high-speed train network to a standstill, leaving some passengers trapped in trains overnight and thousands stranded at stations.

title.children: Spanish travellers spend night on trains after thieves steal copper cables

image.altText: A teenage boy in a white hoodie and black baseball cap

props.synopsis: Three people convicted of murdering 18-year-old Kingsley Alley Jr after a dispute over a spilled drink have launched an appeal to have their guilty verdicts thrown out.

title.children: Trio jailed for NT teenager's murder claim 'miscarriage of justice'

image.altText: A dead ant lies on a reed in the bush.

props.synopsis: Some of the country's top scientists have been working with Indigenous rangers to access rugged parts of the Arnhem Land plateau that are rarely seen, even by traditional owners.

title.children: Zombie ants among striking finds as scientists explore Arnhem Land

image.altText: A woman's arms are pictured - one typing on a laptop while the other holds a credit card.

props.synopsis: Using a credit card linked to your offset account can save on your mortgage but you need to be aware of the pitfalls to decide whether it will work for you.

title.children: Can you maximise your offset account with a credit card?

image.altText: A portable toilet dumped in scrub.

props.synopsis: After a popular rest stop on WA's South Coast Highway was left looking like a landfill, locals and drivers are urging travellers to do better.

title.children: Illegal campers leave 'unbelievable mess' by WA highway

image.altText: A scene of motorbikes and emergency vehicles on a race track.

props.synopsis: A New Zealander and an Englishman die after a "severe and catastrophic" 11-bike crash during a race at Oulton Park.

title.children: New Zealander one of two dead after 'catastrophic' crash during motorbike race

image.altText: Pat Cummins bolwing for Sunrisers in IPL.

props.synopsis: Pat Cummins's Sunrisers Hyderabad are out of the Indian Premier League despite his stellar bowling performance, with rain forcing a draw with Delhi Capitals.

title.children: Cummins treble in vain as rain ends Sunrisers' IPL hopes

image.altText: Zhao Xintong holds the World Snooker Championship trophy.

props.synopsis: After returning last year from a match-fixing scandal, Zhao Xintong makes history with his win over three-time winner Mark Williams at World Snooker Championship.

title.children: Zhao becomes China's first world snooker champion after comeback from ban

image.altText: A woman looking at the camera with medicines on a shelf behind her.

props.synopsis: Doctors raise concerns over calls to extend a Victorian pilot program that allows patients to skip the GP and head straight to the pharmacy for some treatments.

title.children: GPs concerned pharmacy prescribing extension could risk patient health

image.altText: A man running in the outback is flanked by others doing the same

props.synopsis: A man's three-day run puts a spotlight on mental health struggles in the bush and raises more than $25,000 along the way.

title.children: Gruelling 303km outback run shines light on mental health

image.altText: Woman smiles holding microphone close to her mouth, with red curtain in background. She has shoulder-length brown hair.

props.synopsis: Not only did Rose Bishop overcome her fear of public speaking, she turned it into her job. The comedian offers her advice for not letting stage fright — in any setting — get in your way.

title.children: Scared of public speaking? So was Rose, now she's a stand-up comedian
